revised_title: Revisiting the Evolution and Environment of Terrestrial Vertebrates in the Late Silurian and Early Devonian
tldr: This article examines the evolution and environment of terrestrial vertebrates during the late Silurian and early Devonian periods. It challenges the traditional view that the transition from fish to tetrapods occurred in a freshwater environment and proposes a new model suggesting that the ancestors of tetrapods had a basic marine origin. The study also reevaluates the geological and physiological evidence to better understand the environment in which these adaptations evolved.
